task.title: Share Screen on Microsoft Teams
task.shortdesc: While in a Microsoft Teams meeting, users can present content by sharing their screen or entire desktop.

taskbody.prereq: You must have a Microsoft account to use Teams. Screen sharing is available in both the web and app versions of Teams, on a desktop computer or mobile device.

info.note: It is recommended you use the desktop version of Teams to share your screen.

step.cmd: Click the Share button to open the screen-sharing menu.
Choose what you'd like to share with the meeting audience.

chrow.chdesc: Sharing your tab will allow meeting participants to view the tab currently open on your browser.
Sharing your window allows participants to view a specific window or application. All other information on the computer screen will not be shared.
Sharing the entire screen allows participants to view your entire screen.

step.cmd: Share your view with the meeting participants.

info.note: Users will see a red outline around the screen indicating that you are sharing content with those on the Teams meeting.

step.cmd: Click the Audio Sharing button from the presenter toolbar.

info.note: Users can also share computer sound while screen sharing.
